Subject: Re: [junit] TestNG 4 and Data Providers
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=12653864; y=QqjBf88oVkcLZJiBdxVv-KNoNytwfTq9c2hxQy45sIoxP4hP

Cédric Beust ♔ wrote:

> // This method will provide data to any test method that declares that its
> Data Provider
> // is named "test1"
> @DataProvider(name = "test1")
> public Object[][] createData1() {
> return new Object[][] {
> new Object[] { "Cedric", new Integer(36) },
> new Object[] { "Anne", new Integer(37)},
> };
> }


On the plus side, this approach is really, really simple. I'm having 
trouble following all the JUnit 4 parameterized discussions simply 
because I don't feel comfortable with Java 5 annotations and generics 
yet. I just haven't worked enough with these java 5 features that they 
come to me naturally. By contrast, I can read this and see exactly what 
it's doing. Good.

On the minus side, I think this might be too simple. It seems to require 
all the test parameters to be initialized up front. If the parameters or 
their initialization code is large or expensive, this could be a 
problem. I would prefer the parameters to be lazily initialized before 
each test and torn down after each test. This could be done if this 
method returned an Iterator rather than a static array. Any reason it 
wasn't done this way?

--
